jsinterop.annotations

Annotation Type JsEnum


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Documented
public @interface JsEnum
    JsEnum marks a Java enum as being represented as a Closure enum, either one that already exists from the external JavaScript environment, or one that will be accessible from the external JavaScript environment.

    The underlying type of the Closure enum can be specified via hasCustomValue() and declaring an instance field named "value" of the desired type.

    If the JsEnum is non-native and has custom values, a constructor is required to allow specifying the values for the enum constants, as in the following example 

    
   @JsEnum(hasCustomValue=true)
   enum IntJsEnum {
     TEN(10),
     TWENTY(20);

     int value;

     IntJsEnum(int value) { this.value = value; }
   }

    If the JsEnum is native and has custom values, the value field is still required but constructors are not needed nor allowed.

    JsEnums do not support the full Java semantics:

    • No instance fields are allowed other than value,
    • Enum.name() and values() are not supported.
    • Enum.ordinal() is supported only for non-native JsEnums that don't have custom values.
    • The class is initialization might be delayed until a static field/method is accessed.

    The JavaScript namespace and name can be specified in a manner similar to JsTypes via namespace() and name() respectively.

    Methods and fields declared in the JsEnum are only accessible in Java code. Only the enum constants are accessible from JavaScript code.

    This annotation is only supported by J2CL.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean hasCustomValue
      When set to true, this JsEnum will have a custom value defined by a field named 'value'.
      boolean isNative
      When set to true, this JsEnum is a native Closure enum type.
      java.lang.String name
      Customizes the name of the type in generated JavaScript.
      java.lang.String namespace
      Customizes the namespace of the type in generated JavaScript.

    • Element Detail

      • name

        public abstract java.lang.String name
        Customizes the name of the type in generated JavaScript. If not provided, the simple Java name will be used.
        Default:
        "<auto>"

      • namespace

        public abstract java.lang.String namespace
        Customizes the namespace of the type in generated JavaScript.
        Default:
        "<auto>"

      • isNative

        public abstract boolean isNative
        When set to true, this JsEnum is a native Closure enum type.
        Default:
        false

      • hasCustomValue

        public abstract boolean hasCustomValue
        When set to true, this JsEnum will have a custom value defined by a field named 'value'. The only allowed types for the value field are String and primitive types with the exception of long.
        Default:
        false
